resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment: nealrichardson commented on pull request #4696: ARROW-5257: [Website] Update site to use "official" Apache Arrow logo, add clearly marked links to logo URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4696 Header uses an inverted (white print with transparent background) version of the logo because the header has a dark background. The proper black logo (with transparent background) is shown on the "powered by" page, which recommends folks to use that logo when referring to Arrow. The header logo is reduced in size to 300px in height, and then the img tag further reduces display to 60px. That combination got the sharpest rendering of the image with a reasonable file size. As discussed on the jira ticket, a better solution would be to use svg, but this works for now. I also reorganized the powered-by page, putting the projects first and the trademark language last. Given the intended audience of this page, that seems like a more natural order. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on pull request #4696: ARROW-5257: [Website] Update site to use "official" Apache Arrow logo, add clearly marked links to logo URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4696#discussion_r297836612 ########## File path: site/powered_by.md ########## @@ -139,6 +114,36 @@ short description of your use case. See the following for some examples. Arrow internally to maximize performance, and can be used with existing Apache Spark™ APIs. +To add yourself to the list, please open a [pull request][27] adding your +organization name, URL, a list of which Arrow components you are using, and a +short description of your use case. + +### The "Apache Arrow" Trademark and Logo + +Organizations creating products and projects for use with Apache Arrow, along +with associated marketing materials, should take care to respect the trademark +in "Apache Arrow" and its logo. Please refer to [ASF Trademarks Guidance][1] +and associated [FAQ][2] for comprehensive and authoritative guidance on proper +usage of ASF trademarks. + +Names that do not include "Apache Arrow" at all have no potential trademark +issue with the Apache Arrow project. This is recommended. + +Names like "Apache Arrow BigCoProduct" are not OK, as are names including +"Apache Arrow" in general. The above links, however, describe some exceptions, +like for names such as "BigCoProduct, powered by Apache Arrow" or +"BigCoProduct for Apache Arrow". + +It is common practice to create software identifiers (Maven coordinates, module +names, etc.) like "arrow-foo". These are permitted. Nominative use of trademarks +in descriptions is also always allowed, as in "BigCoProduct is a widget for +Apache Arrow". + +Projects and documents that want to include a logo for Apache Arrow should use +the official logo: + + Review comment: I think the trademark usage stuff needs to go back at the top of the page, otherwise it may not get seen as often (see e.g. http://spark.apache.org/powered-by.html). ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
See logo at https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1qmvPpFU7sdm9l6A6LEyI0zIzswGtJW0Sbd_lfHLaXQs/edit#slide=id.g4258234456_0_1

An unofficial logo lacking the "Apache" has been making the rounds on the internet, so I think it would be a good idea to update our web properties with the approved logo as discussed on the mailing list

Whoever does this task -- please make sure to compress the PNG asset of the logo prior to checking in to source control
fields.summary: [Website] Update site to use "official" Apache Arrow logo, add clearly marked links to logo

comments.body: Which file needs to be updated, [https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/site/img/arrow.png]? I don't see that being referenced in /site in the repository.
And/or should we add official assets to [http://arrow.apache.org/powered_by/], since that discusses branding?
Yes, that image needs to be updated, but I don't think it's used anywhere. I think the Powered By page would be a great place to put the logo, and additionally on the front page

Do you have any other design assets (like an svg version) anywhere? I can make this work with the one from the presentation but it would be better if there were originals. 

I added a transparent background to the image in the presentation (not perfectly) and experimented with sticking it in the top left of the page, where you'd expect it and where other Apache projects tend to put their logo, and it's not awesome. IMO we either should make a white version of the logo/wordmark, change the header not to be dark, or both. 

 

!image-2019-05-03-16-19-05-041.png!
I see. [~kstirman] can you assist with this since I believe you created this logo originally?

For the website header, we can keep the dark gray background and use a white version of the logo, like this. Thoughts? If you want to keep it black everywhere, I'll need to make revisions to the site theme (not a problem, just confirming).

 

!image-2019-05-08-13-15-53-694.png!
The white logo seems fine. Somewhere we need to give people an obvious path to obtaining the black official logo PNG asset, though
Yeah, I'm planning to use white there and then put the black version on the powered-by page. Planning to do that today actually–sound good?
